thread.title: Beach Energy managing director Rob Cole resigns citing family issues
thread.title_full: Beach Energy managing director Rob Cole resigns citing family issues | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: MICHAEL RODDAN
title: Beach Energy managing director Rob Cole resigns citing family issues
text:
BEACH Energy managing director Rob Cole has resigned from the struggling Australian oil and gas company.
Mr Cole, who was unable to front an investor briefing in August for personal reasons, has been on leave attending family matters in Perth.
“As a result of those matters, Mr Cole has decided it is not possible to return to a full-time executive role with Beach in Adelaide,” the company said today. “He has accordingly resigned.”
Mr Cole replaced long-time managing director Reg Nelson in March.
Beach waived the notice requirements under Mr Cole's contract, but said he would remain with the group until October 14 to allow for an orderly transition.
Neil Gibbins will continue as interim chief executive until a new managing director is appointed.
Beach said the executive and staff were committed to delivering the turnaround strategy announced on August 12 that Mr Cole was unable to deliver.
Beach last month revealed it had suffered a full-year loss on impairments and low oil prices.
The company recorded a net loss of $514.1 million for the year to June, compared with the previous year's profit of $101.78 million.
Originally published as Beach chief Rob Cole stands down
